title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0183

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Katherine, and today we have an elementary level lesson for you.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，今天我们为你们准备了一节初级课程。

segments.en: That's right, we are going to talk about winter, but specifically about the clothes you wear during winter when it's very, very cold outside.
segments.cn: 没错，我们要谈论冬天，特别是当外面非常非常冷时你穿的衣服。

segments.en: That's right, and I hear you're not too familiar with some of these practices, because where you come from, you don't really have winter.
segments.cn: 没错，我听说你对这些习惯不太熟悉，因为你来自的地方没有真正的冬天。

segments.en: We have dry season and rainy season, but same temperature.
segments.cn: 我们有干季和雨季，但温度是一样的。

segments.en: Well, Chicago definitely has a snowy season, so I'm very familiar with these things, so let's jump right into today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，芝加哥肯定有下雪的季节，所以我对这些事情很熟悉，我们直接进入今天的对话吧。

segments.en: We'll be hearing it one time, and in a minute we'll be back to talk about it.
segments.cn: 我们会听一次，然后再回来讨论。

segments.en: No, wait, you'll be too cold without mittens.
segments.cn: 不，等等，没有手套你会太冷。

segments.en: With that wind, you're going to catch a cold.
segments.cn: 这么大的风，你会感冒的。

segments.en: So there were a couple of different items of clothing that we saw in this dialogue, so let's look at them now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 在这个对话中我们看到了一些不同的衣物，现在让我们在语言要点中看看它们。

segments.en: Okay, well, first of all, we have Mom and Jimmy.
segments.cn: 好吧，首先，我们有妈妈和Jimmy。

segments.en: And Mom is saying goodbye to him, but first she wants him to put on clothes.
segments.cn: 妈妈在和他说再见，但首先她想让他穿上衣服。

segments.en: So the first item, the first thing she asks him to put on is a hat.
segments.cn: 所以她让他穿的第一件衣服是帽子。

segments.en: Now, you've probably seen, like, a baseball cap or many different types of hats, and sometimes in other languages they have specific names for a hat for winter, right, but in English it's a hat.
segments.cn: 你可能见过棒球帽或许多不同类型的帽子，有时在其他语言中，冬天的帽子有特定的名称，但在英语中就是帽子。

segments.en: Anything that covers your head is a hat.
segments.cn: 任何覆盖你头部的东西都是帽子。

segments.en: That's kind of like the category.
So maybe this one is a warm wool hat, but in the end it's a hat.
segments.cn: 所以也许这是一顶温暖的羊毛帽，但最终它就是一顶帽子。

segments.en: Okay, so he's put on the hat.
Now what else is he going to put on?
Well, we need to keep our fingers warm.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们需要保持手指温暖。

segments.en: Okay, so there are two kinds of ways to keep your fingers warm, and the way in this dialogue that the boy keeps his fingers warm is with mittens.
segments.cn: 好吧，有两种方法可以保持手指温暖，而在这个对话中，男孩用手套来保持手指温暖。

segments.en: All right, so mittens you put on your hands.
segments.cn: 好吧，手套是戴在手上的。

segments.en: Now what's the difference between mittens and gloves?
segments.cn: 那么手套和手套有什么区别呢？

segments.en: Okay, gloves have special places for each finger.
segments.cn: 好吧，手套有每个手指的特殊位置。

segments.en: One, two, three, four, five on each hand.
segments.cn: 每只手有一、二、三、四、五个。

segments.en: One for your thumb and one for all your other fingers.
segments.cn: 一个是拇指，一个是其他所有手指。

segments.en: Okay, so that means you can't really hold things.
segments.cn: 好吧，这意味着你不能真正握东西。

segments.en: So you kind of look like a penguin or something like that.
segments.cn: 所以你看起来有点像企鹅。
而且这主要是给孩子们的。

segments.en: Adults don't wear mittens because adults need to hold things like keys and phones and car steering wheels.
segments.cn: 成人不穿手套，因为成人需要握住钥匙、手机和汽车方向盘。

segments.en: So in this case, mittens is usually for children.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，手套通常是给孩子的。

segments.en: Okay, so mittens, and while the mother is still a little bit worried, so she tells him to wear a scarf.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以手套，而妈妈还是有点担心，所以她告诉他要戴上围巾。

segments.en: Okay, a scarf is a long, usually made of wool, a long piece of fabric that you put around your neck to keep your neck warm.
segments.cn: 好吧，围巾是一条长的，通常是羊毛制成的布，围在脖子上以保持脖子温暖。

segments.en: Okay, and he's put on the mittens, the scarf, the hat, and he's missing some earmuffs.
segments.cn: 好吧，他戴上了手套、围巾、帽子，但还缺少耳罩。

segments.en: Okay, this is a little funny because usually if you're wearing a hat, you don't need earmuffs.
segments.cn: 好吧，这有点搞笑，因为通常如果你戴着帽子，就不需要耳罩。

segments.en: But earmuffs are like headphones, but they keep your ears warm.
segments.cn: 但耳罩就像耳机，但它们保持你的耳朵温暖。

segments.en: And we wear these, they don't cover your head, they just cover your ears.
segments.cn: 我们戴这些，它们不覆盖你的头，只覆盖你的耳朵。

segments.en: And usually they're just two round circles over your ears.
segments.cn: 通常它们只是两个圆圈在你的耳朵上。

segments.en: So as you say, exactly, they look like big earphones, and they keep your ears warm.
segments.cn: 所以正如你所说，确实，它们看起来像大耳机，保持你的耳朵温暖。

segments.en: Now, as you say, you usually don't wear this if you're wearing a hat because, well, you would put your ears inside your hat, right?
segments.cn: 现在，正如你所说，通常如果你戴着帽子就不会戴这个，因为你会把耳朵放在帽子里，对吧？

segments.en: So it looks pretty silly if he's wearing all of this together.
segments.cn: 所以如果他把这些全部穿在一起，看起来就很傻。

segments.en: All right, and so those four key items, those four key pieces of clothing are for our language takeaway today.
segments.cn: 好吧，这四件关键物品，今天的语言要点就是这些。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to this dialogue again, and we'll come back soon to talk about Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们再听一次这个对话，然后很快回来讨论流利度提升。

segments.en: No, wait, you'll be too cold without mittens.
segments.cn: 不，等等，没有手套你会太冷。

segments.en: Hold on, with that wind, you're gonna catch a cold.
segments.cn: 等一下，风这么大，你会感冒的。

segments.en: Oh, and earmuffs, put these on.
So now let's take a look at four key phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利度提升的四个关键短语。

segments.en: Okay, this first phrase, as I said before, has to do with the mom and the boy saying goodbye to each other.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个第一个短语，正如我之前所说，涉及到妈妈和男孩互相道别。

segments.en: So he says, all right, see ya.
Okay, so see as in to look to, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以“见”是指看，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, so this is a very spoken language way of saying you.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种非常口语化的说法，表示“你”。

segments.en: So we could say, see you later.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说，稍后见你。

segments.en: But if you want to make it shorter, you can say, see ya.
segments.cn: 但如果你想让它更简短，可以说，见。

segments.en: And then what's our next way of saying goodbye?
segments.cn: 那我们下一个告别的方式是什么？

segments.en: Oh, wait, that's... We're not there yet.
segments.cn: 哦，等等，那... 我们还没到。

segments.en: No, hold on is our next phrase.
segments.cn: 不，等一下是我们的下一个短语。

segments.en: And this is a way to say, wait.
So you just say, hold on.
It's just a little bit more casual.
You have to use these two words together.
segments.cn: 你必须把这两个词一起使用。

segments.en: So like I said before with Marco, who wants to go fast, I could say, hold on.
segments.cn: 就像我之前对马尔科说的，他想快点，我可以说，等一下。

segments.en: And now you gotta be careful because you're going to catch a cold.
segments.cn: 现在你得小心，因为你会感冒。

segments.en: So a cold is when you cough, you have a sore throat, it's starting to get cold outside and you don't feel well.
segments.cn: 感冒是指你咳嗽，喉咙痛，外面开始变冷，你感觉不舒服。

segments.en: So you have a runny nose.
And most people get this every year.
segments.cn: 大多数人每年都会得这个。

segments.en: But you don't get a cold, you catch a cold.
segments.cn: 但你不是得感冒，而是感冒了。

segments.en: So catch is the same word we use for when we talk about sports, like throwing and catching.
segments.cn: 所以“catch”是我们在谈论运动时使用的同一个词，比如投掷和接球。

segments.en: It's almost like it just hits you.
So that's really important what you just said because you don't use the verb get.
segments.cn: 所以你刚才说的真的很重要，因为你不使用动词“get”。

segments.en: Or if you say that you were sick last week because you had a cold, you would say, oh, I caught a cold or I had a cold.
segments.cn: 或者如果你说你上周生病是因为感冒了，你会说，哦，我感冒了或者我得了感冒。

segments.en: I caught a cold last week.
And our last phrase for Fluency Builder is here we go.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个流利表达是“我们开始吧”。

segments.en: So when do we hear this phrase?
segments.cn: 那我们什么时候听到这个短语？

segments.en: The mother says to the boy, put these on.
segments.cn: 妈妈对男孩说，戴上这些。

segments.en: So she's doing something with him.
She's helping him put his earmuffs on.
And here we go is a way to say, okay, I've finished.
segments.cn: “我们开始吧”是一种说法，表示“好的，我完成了”。

segments.en: So we say, here we go.
segments.cn: 所以我们说，我们开始吧。

segments.en: So maybe I'm on my computer and I have a problem and I'm waiting, waiting, waiting, waiting, waiting.
segments.cn: 所以也许我在电脑上遇到问题，我在等待，等待，等待，等待，等待。

segments.en: And you know, when the bar's loading and finally, it's ready.
segments.cn: 你知道，当进度条加载时，最后，它准备好了。

segments.en: Or sometimes a waitress will come and serve you food and say, here we go.
segments.cn: 或者有时女服务员会来给你上菜，说，我们开始吧。

segments.en: So this is a way to say what you've been waiting for is ready now.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种说法，表示你一直在等待的东西现在准备好了。

segments.en: So I think it's time for us to listen to this dialogue one last time before we come back.
segments.cn: 所以我想是时候让我们最后一次听这个对话，然后再回来。

segments.en: No, wait, you'll be too cold without mittens.
segments.cn: 不，等一下，没有手套你会太冷。

segments.en: With that wind, you're going to catch a cold.
So as you mentioned in Chicago, it's very, very cold.
segments.cn: 正如你在芝加哥提到的，那里非常非常冷。

segments.en: So I imagine you had all of these winter clothes, right?
segments.cn: 所以我想你有所有这些冬季衣物，对吧？

segments.en: And it's funny because I remember being a small child and my mother doing this to me, putting on snow pants and boots and earmuffs and hats and gloves and scarves.
segments.cn: 有趣的是，我记得小时候我妈妈也这样给我穿上雪裤、靴子、耳罩、帽子、手套和围巾。

segments.en: And all of a sudden, it's so hot inside because you're wearing everything.
segments.cn: 突然间，里面热得要命，因为你穿了所有的东西。

segments.en: And so you can't even walk.
Like you were saying, you look like a penguin walking out the door and then you get to school and you're sweating, right?
segments.cn: 就像你说的，你看起来像一只企鹅走出门，然后到学校时你在出汗，对吧？

segments.en: And so in school we had to take, we had a special room and we had to take everything off because there's snow everywhere and snow can be very dangerous because it melts and it turns into water.
segments.cn: 所以在学校我们必须去一个特殊的房间，把所有东西脱掉，因为外面到处都是雪，雪可能非常危险，因为它融化后变成水。

segments.en: Okay, so I have very strong memories of all of this.
segments.cn: 好吧，我对这一切有很强烈的记忆。

segments.en: Putting them on, taking them off and just being warm all the time.
segments.cn: 穿上它们，脱掉它们，时刻保持温暖。

segments.en: Well, yeah, when it's cold or you live in a place with cold weather, you have to have these items of clothing because otherwise you might catch a cold.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，当天气冷或者你住在寒冷的地方时，你必须有这些衣物，否则你可能会感冒。

segments.en: So I hope that no one out there catches a cold, but if you want some suggestions, wear a scarf, cover your neck.
segments.cn: 所以我希望外面没有人感冒，但如果你想要一些建议，戴上围巾，保护好你的脖子。

segments.en: Your head and your scarf are the most important.
segments.cn: 你的头和围巾是最重要的。

segments.en: All right, and if you guys have any other questions or comments, you can visit our website, EnglishPod.com, and we'll see everyone there.
segments.cn: 好的，如果你们有其他问题或评论，可以访问我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，我们在那里见。
